title: Ideal gas law - temperature at zero pressure

content.question: The graph shows the pressure of a gas in a sealed container as a function of the temperature of the gas. Which of the following claims are supported by the graph?

choices.label: There is a temperature that corresponds to zero pressure.
There is a maximum possible temperature of an ideal gas.
The pressure of a gas is proportional to the volume of the gas at a constant temperature.
The temperature of a gas is proportional to the volume of the gas at a constant pressure.

content.answer: There is a temperature that corresponds to zero pressure.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
